header_summary: The email discusses incorporating a DH cryptosystem in the BIP, using a public key. Leaked BIP 21 URIs pose no risk for loss of funds. QR codes should display URIs using the base64 version, and UR encoding is recommended for efficiency with QR codes. Tony and Bastien discuss deanonymizing techniques on the Lightning Network, including timing and CLTV.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin
recent_posts.summary:
- The BIP now includes a DH cryptosystem for secure communication between sender and receiver.
- The receiver shares only a public key in the BIP 21 to ensure safety.
- The update aims to balance convenience and protection against leaked BIP 21 URIs.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin (AdamISZ)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email suggests that the URI version of base64 is recommended.
- If QR codes are used, either option will double the density of the QR.
- UR encoding is efficient with QR codes and can animate large data carried.

recent_posts.title: segwit naming ambiguity
recent_posts.summary:
- The topic of "is_segwit" is discussed, referring to segwit v0 outputs as "p2wsh" or "p2wpkh".
- There is no specific term for "p2wsh or p2wpkh but not p2tr".
- Andrew Poelstra from Blockstream provides this information along with his contact details.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- Revisit post-PTLCs scenario and consider making keysend MPP for CLN and LDK.
- Encourage others to support this feature for the sender's consideration of claimed payment.
- Recipient can choose to claim less than amount sent, sender considers payment sent.

recent_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
recent_posts.summary:
- Deanonymizing techniques on the LN only reveal the recipient, not the sender.
- Acinq is aware of sender and destination for payments with Phoenix on LN.
- Blinded paths can preserve sender privacy on LN, only revealing the introduction node.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- The team has been recording and transcribing bi-weekly specification meetings since the start of the year.
- The records are shared for potential use and can be accessed at https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification.
- Gurwinder from Chaincode verifies the accuracy of the transcripts through manual checks.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- A blinded statechains implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 is being implemented.
- The server in this implementation remains 'blinded' and does not gain certain information.
- The protocol involves multiple parties generating keys and aggregating them to sign a message.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark, a new second-layer protocol, offers an alternative to the Lightning network.
- Ark allows users to send and receive funds without liquidity constraints and with minimal on-chain footprint.
- The protocol uses virtual UTXOs (vTXOs) and an intermediary called the Ark Service Provider (ASP) for anonymous, off-chain payments.

active_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
active_posts.summary:
- Wallets can be compromised or lost, making addresses toxic and funds easily lost.
- Silent Payments allow multiple payments to a single address without privacy concerns.
- Solution is adding a 3 byte field to silent payment addresses encoding the expiration date.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- LNbits team patched an exploit in version 0.10.5 that allowed attackers to create balances.
- The attack involved inserting a payment hash of payment A into a different payment.
- Developers are encouraged to refer to the "payment hash" as the "preimage hash" to avoid assumptions.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the plan discussed at the summit to validate local reputation algorithms using real-world data.
- The plan includes collecting anonymized forwarding data in a CSV format and propagating an experimental TLV called "endorsement" through the network.
- We will also implement local reputation algorithms and prioritize privacy throughout the process.
